title: What if Garen's Silence was buffed to OVER 2.5seconds, but changed into a cripple?
body:
A type of CC that prevents the target from using mobility spells.

The same way that a root prevents them, except for cripples wouldn't stop standard walking.

Say it lasts for up to 4 seconds at max rank.  **(NOTE: Down from 5.  I hear you guys - 5s is a bit too long against some champions.  but going from a 2.5s silence to a 4 second cripple is a decent trade-off.  It prevents way less spells, but gets 1.5s more duration at rank 5.)**

**EDIT: It would also interrupt channels at the start, like his current silence.**

So - for example - Riven wouldn't be able to Q or E still.  ADCs wouldn't be able to dash away.  No one could flash.

Because it opens up more counterplay than a silence, it would allow him to still stick to targets while also opening up his kit for even more buffs.
Aside from aiding him in sticking to targets, it'd give him a more solid identity of not letting targets escape, who are usually way too slippery.  I.E. Nidalee, Riven, etc.

A funny effect of this is that it COULD essentially act as a Blind on Kalista as well, preventing her hopping, if Riot wanted her passive to function as a 'mobility spell'.  (But she'd have new options, such as using her Ulti still, whereas before she would be silenced out of it.)

Another idea - it could possibly function as a silence (like before) when used on the 'Villain'.  (The enemy that gets marked with the new function in his rework.)  But that would be way too much with the 5s duration, so there would need to be more tuning.

This is just a thought.  What are your opinions?

> Also, he still has to get into melee range.  Following the rework, he'll almost certainly max the spin first.  So the cripple would remain at 1-2 seconds for most of the early-into-mid game.
>

> 
> Does that seriously sound that strong?  You don't think 5 seconds is fair, even though it doesn't slow the enemy, lets them walk freely, and allows WAY more counterplay than the current silence?

Cripple as a mechanic is a pretty interesting idea. We were talking about some pretty similar stuff internally not too long ago. We'd probably need to establish some sort of semi-universal language for what a cripple looked like, and what all its rules were, and then exactly what was and wasn't stopped from being cast by it.

As to whether it would be a good fit for Decisive Strike, it's possible. It would probably come down to whether Decisive Strike's crowd control's intended purpose was to stop people from casting entirely (Silence) or simply to help Garen hit Judgment more reliably. There's probably an argument for either.

Ok, Repertoir, hear me out here.   I know you guys are really trying to make League its own game, and you've done a great job of that, I don't think anyone in their right minds who has played a MOBA could ever confuse DOTA with League, or League with Smite, and vice versa.  But in terms of the hard crowd control effect "cripple", it has to be constant across all games.

The way cripple is done in Smite is that it prevents all dash and leap based abilities.  Every other ability works as intended.  For example, if I were to somehow bring Ares into League, land my shackles on say, LeBlanc, LeBlanc would be able to cast her Q and E, but not her W.  If I were to cripple Thresh, he could cast his Q to land his hook, but couldn't recast it to jump to his target.  

I think we can all agree that the mobility creep has overstayed its welcome.  These Juggernaut changes are a good first step.  Now it's time to really shoot mobile champs in the foot.  Cripple is a good way to really get rid of the hopscotch that's going on in League right now.  An even better one would be to give a future champion an ultimate ability that only works on champions mid dash (in the same way Yasuo can only cast his ultimate on airborne targets) and pull them to said champion (like Awilix does in Smite).

You do this, and champion diversity becomes a real thing again.

AIGHT a cripple stops any movement abilities from as small as tumble to ahris dashes. Shens TP wouldnt be affected because its not really a movement its actual teleportation. So dashes and stuff like that would be disabled. Cripple cc would also have a slight slow (thinking 20%) on it as well (when you are crippled you dont move as fast i mean come on). Thats the general guidelines I would think would be part of the cripple cc type.

I'd almost won't you to add cripple to Kog'Maw and Singed's adhesives, even if it means reducing the slow strengths to make it easier to get out of. Cripple is probably the most interesting opposition to mobility meta - especially if you couple it with knockdown (like Malz's R, Veigar's E, etc). "Enemies hit by Void Ooze are knocked down (if airborne) and crippled while they remaining in the ooze."

That said, I feel like I should point out that this sounds like an arms race. Mobility creep is met by anti-mobility creep. You're just playing top trumps. Would an alternative solution simply be to make mobility interact with existing crowd control effects? Slows reduce dash speed, for example (heck, MS modifiers both positive and negative - since the nerf should be coupled with a minor compensation). Cripple would make an excellent addition, I feel, but it shouldn't be the only solution. Garen shouldn't be the only option in champion select. Nasus should be able to Wither Riven and slow her down, both moving and her Q's speed. Aside from maybe adding a few dashes that are specifically immune to slows (e.g. Tristana, Corki, Zac, etc, for visual reasons ["jump" would finally be an actual distinctive effect, even], and maybe abilities like Lucian's E as a specific perk to the champion).
